en: We're experimenting with some initial support for national languages. We're in a very preliminary stage, but we hope to be able to support more languages, soon.
de: Wir experimentieren mit einer grundlegenden Unterstützung für Landessprachen. Wir befinden uns in einem sehr frühen Stadium, hoffen aber, bald noch weitere Sprachen unterstützen zu können.
es: Estamos experimentando con algún soporte inicial para los idiomas nacionales. Estamos en una etapa muy preliminar, pero esperamos poder soportar más idiomas, pronto.
fr: Nous expérimentons un soutien initial pour les langues nationales. Nous sommes dans une phase très préliminaire, mais nous espérons être en mesure de prendre en charge plus de langues, bientôt.

en: STAR TREK and related marks and logos are trademarks of CBS Studios Inc. All Rights Reserved.
de: STAR TREK and related marks and logos are trademarks of CBS Studios Inc. All Rights Reserved.
es: STAR TREK y las marcas y logotipos relacionados son marcas comerciales de CBS Studios Inc. Todos los derechos reservados.
fr: STAR TREK et les marques et logos associés sont des marques commerciales de CBS Studios Inc. Tous droits réservés.

en: Select sources. Ask your GM which are available.
de: Wählen Sie die verfügbaren Quellen aus. Fragen Sie, wenn nötig, Ihre Spielleitung, welche zur Verfügung stehen.
es: Seleccione las fuentes. Pregúntele a su GM cuáles están disponibles.
fr: Sélectionnez les sources. Demandez à votre MJ lesquels sont disponibles.

en: Some sources are not yet implemented; check back soon!
de: Einige Quellen sind noch nicht verfügbar - schauen Sie bald wieder vorbei!
es: Algunas fuentes aún no se han aplicado; ¡Vuelve pronto!
fr: Certaines sources ne sont pas encore mises en œuvre; Revenez bientôt!

en: Select which Era to play in. Ask your GM which Era to choose.
de: Wählen Sie aus, in welcher Ära gespielt wird. Fragen Sie, wenn nötig, Ihre Spielleitung, welche Ära Sie wählen sollen.
es: Selecciona en qué Era jugar. Pregúntale a tu GM qué Era elegir.
fr: Sélectionnez l'ère dans laquelle jouer. Demandez à votre MJ quelle ère choisir.

en: Things have gone terribly, terribly wrong. We might be in the mirror universe.
de: Etwas ist ganz schrecklich schief gelaufen. Wir könnten uns im Spiegeluniversum befinden.
es: Las cosas han ido terriblemente, terriblemente mal. Podríamos estar en el universo espejo.
fr: Les choses ont terriblement, terriblement mal tourné. Nous pourrions être dans l'univers miroir.

en: Use this tool to manage various NPCs in your game.
de: Benutzen Sie dieses Werkzeug, um die verschiedenen NSCs in Ihrem Spiel zu verwalten.
es: Usa esta herramienta para administrar varios NPC en tu juego.
fr: Utilisez cet outil pour gérer divers PNJ dans votre jeu.

en: Paste in the URL for a character.
de: Fügen Sie die URL eines Charakters ein.
es: Pegue la URL de un carácter.

en: This url does not look valid.
de: Diese URL sieht nicht gültig aus.
fr: Cette URL ne semble pas valide.

en: Whoops! We only support characters, at the moment. Not starships.
de: Hoppla! Wir unterstützen im Moment nur Charaktere. Keine Raumschiffe.
es: ¡Gritos! Solo admitimos personajes, por el momento. No naves espaciales.
fr: Nous ne supportons que les personnages, pour le moment. Pas des vaisseaux spatiaux.

en: Your character has a Talent ("Advanced Team Dynamics") that precludes Young characters
What's the name of this species?
de: Wie lautet der Name dieser Spezies?
fr: Quel est le nom de cette espèce?

en: Each species gets a species-specific trait that may provide additional benefits in special circumstances.
de: Jede Spezies erhält ein bestimmtes Merkmal, das in bestimmten Situationen zusätzliche Vorteile gewähren kann.

en: Please provide a name for this species.
de: Bitte einen Namen für diese Spezies angeben.
fr: Merci de fournir un nom pour cette espèce

en: What type of character is this?
de: Um was für eine Art von Charakter handelt es sich?

en: What government does this character represent?
What's the name of this government?
de: Wie lautet der Name dieser Regierung?
fr: Quel est le nom du gouvernement?

en: What military does this character represent?
What's the name of this military?
de: Wie lautet der Name dieses Militärs?
fr: Quel est le nom de l'armée?

en: You must select 1 Attribute to improve before proceeding.
You must select 1 Discipline to improve before proceeding.
Either select or roll your Environment.

Regardless of their species, Starfleet officers come from many places, across many worlds. While many Humans (for example) are born on Earth, there are many more who were born on a colonized world elsewhere in the Galaxy, or on a starbase or a starship.

The Klingon Empire is vast and expands with each new conquest. Thus, Klingons come from many different worlds, from the likes of Qo’noS and Khitomer in the heart of the Empire, to border colonies that may have only been claimed in the last generation. Further, as a culture which has been spacefaring for centuries, countless Klingons are raised in space, aboard starbases and transport ships across the Empire.

Regardless of their species, people come from many places, across many worlds. While many Humans (for example) are born on Earth, there are many more who were born on a colonized world elsewhere in the Galaxy, or on a starbase or a starship.

Regardless of their species, diplomats come from many places, across many worlds. While many Humans (for example) are born on Earth, there are many more who were born on a colonized world elsewhere in the Galaxy, or on a starbase or a starship.

Regardless of their species, Starfleet cadets come from many places, across many worlds. While many Humans (for example) are born on Earth, there are many more who were born on a colonized world elsewhere in the Galaxy, or on a starbase or a starship.

Regardless of their species, children come from many places, across many worlds. While many Humans (for example) are born on Earth, there are many more who were born on a colonized world elsewhere in the Galaxy, or on a starbase or a starship.
Regardless of their species, military officers and ratings come from many places, across many types of worlds.
Please select the modification that you want to apply to this character:
de: Wählen Sie die gewünschte Änderung an Ihrem Charakter aus
fr: Selectionnez la modification que vous voulez appliquer à ce personnage

en: What kind of milestone is being applied?
fr: Quel genre de jalon d'expérience est appliqué?

en: Select a new rank for this character.
de: Wählen Sie einen neuen Rang für diesen Charakter
fr: Selectionnez un nouveau grade pour ce personnage

en: Adjust the character's reputation as appropriate.
de: Passen Sie das Ansehen des Charakters an, wenn nötig
fr: Ajustez la réputation du personnage le cas échéant

en: Select what type of modification you want to apply for this milestone.
de: Wählen Sie die gewünschte Änderung, die Sie mit diesem Meilenstein vornehmen möchten

en:
The character has been modified. You can view the revised character, or make another modification.

You might want to save the URL for the revised character.
de:
Der Charakter wurde geändert. Sie können sich nun den geänderten Charakter ansehen oder eine weitere Änderung vornehmen.

Es ist ratsam, die URL des überarbeiteten Charakters zu speichern.
fr:
Le personnage a été modifié. Vous pouvez voir le personnage modifié ou faire une autre modification
 
Vous pouvez vouloir sauvegarder l'URL pour le personnage modifié

en: Do you want a standard spaceframe, or a custom spaceframe?

de: Spezies-übergreifende Talente erlauben (Entscheidung liegt bei der Spielleitung)
fr: Autoriser les talents inter-espèces (Decision du GM)

de: Esoterische Talente erlauben (Entscheidung liegt bei der Spielleitung)
fr: Autoriser les talents ésoteriques (Decision du GM)

en: The standard Starship creation process follows the build steps as outlined in the rulebooks. E.g.: starships choose a Spaceframe, Mission Profile, etc.
de: Der Standardprozess zur Raumschiff-Erschaffung folgt den Schritten, die in den Regelwerken beschrieben sind (zum Beispiel Klasse auswählen, ein Missionsprofil usw.)
es: El proceso estándar de creación de Starship sigue los pasos de compilación descritos en los libros de reglas. Por ejemplo: las naves espaciales eligen un marco espacial, un perfil de misión, etc.
fr: Le processus standard de création d'un Vaisseau suit les étapes de construction décrites dans les livres de règles. Par exemple: les vaisseaux spatiaux choisissent une trame spatiale, un profil de mission, etc.

en: The Simplified build is a good option for transcribing a set of stats, say from an online source or other other reference.
de: Die vereinfachte Erschaffung ist eine gute Option zur Übernahme einer Reihe von Werten, zum Beispiel aus einer Online-Quelle oder einer anderen Referenz.
es: La compilación simplificada es una buena opción para transcribir un conjunto de estadísticas, por ejemplo, de una fuente en línea u otra referencia.
fr: La version simplifiée est une bonne option pour transcrire un ensemble de statistiques, par exemple à partir d'une source en ligne ou d'une autre référence.

en:
What is the current year in your campaign? You'll probably need to consult your GM.

A default year will be filled in automatically dependent on the chosen Era.
de:
Was ist das aktuelle Jahr Ihrer Kampagne?

Fragen Sie im Zweifelsfall die Spielleitung. Eine Voreinstellung wird abhängig von der Ära der Kampagne automatisch vorgenommen.
fr:
Quelle est l'année de votre campagne?

Vous devez probablement consulter votre GM. Une année par défaut est renseignée en fonction de l'ère choisie

en: What type of starship is this?
de: Um welche Art Raumschiff handelt es sich?
fr: Quel est le type de vaisseau?

en: How big of a vessel is it?
fr: Quel est la taille du vaisseau?
Quel est la largeur du vaisseau

en: What's the name of the ship's class?
de: Wie lautet der Name der Schiffsklasse?
fr: Quel est le nom de la classe du vaisseau?

en: What year did this spaceframe enter service?
de: In welchem Jahr wurde diese Schiffsklasse in Dienst gestellt?
fr: Quel est la date de la mise en service de la classe de vaisseau

de: Wählen Sie die Art des Charakters.

fr: Quel est l'âge de votre personnage

en: Determine what purpose the Supporting Character will fill. Are they an engineer, or a doctor, or a scientist, or a security officer?
de: Welchen Zweck soll der Nebencharakter erfüllen? Ist er zum Beispiel ein Ingenieur, Arzt, Wissenschafter oder Sicherheitsoffizier?
fr: Determine quel rôle le personnage remplira. Sera-t'il un ingénieur, ou un docteur, ou un scientifique, ou un officier de sécurité?

en: Assign Attribute scores and choose the character's species. The chosen species will affect the final Attribute scores. Select two different values to swap them.
de: Weisen Sie die Attributswerte zu und wählen Sie die Spezies des Charakters. Die gewählte Spezies wirkt sich am Ende auf die Attributswerte aus. Um zwei Werte zu vertauschen, wählen Sie beide aus.
fr: Assignez les scores d'Attributs et choisissez l'espèce du personnage. L'espèce choisie influera sur les valeurs finales des attributs.

en: Assign the character's Disciplines. The highest value should match up with the department/purpose of the character. Select two different values to swap them.
de: Weisen Sie die Diziplin-Werte zu. Der höchste Wert sollte der Abteilung bzw. dem Zweck des Charakters entsprechen. Um zwei Werte zu vertauschen, wählen Sie beide aus.
fr: Assignez les Disciplines de votre personnage. La plus haute valeur devrait corresponddre au département/rôle de votre personnage

en: Choose three Focuses for the character. At least one should reflect the department/purpose of the character.
de: Wählen Sie drei Fokusse für den Charakter. Zumindest einer davon sollte die Abteilung bzw. den Zweck des Charakters widerspiegeln.
fr: Choisissez trois Spécialités pour votre personnage. Au moins un devrait représenter le département/rôle de votre personnage.

en: Give the character an appropriate name and rank. Supporting Characters should never have a rank above Lieutenant and may often be enlisted personnel rather than officers.
de: Geben Sie dem Charakter einen passenden Namen und Rang. Nebencharaktere sollten keinen höheren Rang als Lieutenant haben und sind oftmals sogar Mannschaftsdienstgrade anstatt von Offizieren.
fr: Donnez au personnage un nom et un grade approprié. Les personnages secondaires ne peuvent pas avoir un grade supérieur à Lieutenant et sont très sonvant du personnel enrôlé plutôt que des officiers.

en: What do you want to create?
The character is defined by their potential more than their skill. Their raw talent and their expectations of what the universe is like have not yet been tempered by reality.
The character receives a Value, which must reflect the character’s inexperience and naïveté in some way.
The character has several years of experience in service of Starfleet, and is enjoying a promising career.
The character receives a Value, and this can be chosen freely.

The character has decades of experience in the service of Starfleet, and has served on many ships, and starbases. The character’s judgement and opinions are highly-regarded by subordinates, peers, and even superiors.
The character receives a Value, which must reflect the character’s years of experience and the beliefs they’ve formed over their long career.
The character is defined by their potential more than their skill. Their raw talent and their expectations of what the universe is like have not yet been tempered by reality.
The character receives a Value, which must reflect the character’s inexperience and naïveté in some way.
The character has several years of experience in service, and is enjoying a promising career.
The character receives a Value, and this can be chosen freely.

The character has decades of experience in the service, and has served on many ships, worlds, and/or starbases. The character’s judgement and opinions are highly-regarded by subordinates, peers, and even superiors.
The character receives a Value, which must reflect the character’s years of experience and the beliefs they’ve formed over their long career.
The character is defined by their potential more than their skill. Their raw talent and their expectations of what the universe is like have not yet been tempered by reality.
The character receives a Value, which must reflect the character’s inexperience and naïveté in some way.
The character has several years of experience in service of the Empire and is enjoying a promising career. This is the default assumption for characters created using these rules.
The character receives a Value, and this can be chosen freely.

The character has decades of experience in the service of the Empire, and has served on many ships and space stations. The character’s judgement and opinions are highly regarded by subordinates, peers, and even superiors.
The character receives a Value, which must reflect the character’s years of experience and the beliefs they’ve formed over their long career.

The character comes from the world that birthed their civilization, and has been surrounded by cultural and spiritual legacies their entire life. Species homeworlds are often utopian and idyllic, serving as the platonic ideal of that species’ culture. They also exemplify aspects of a culture’s most revered traditions, and serve as the heart of that civilization’s legal and political landscape.

The character comes from one of their culture’s oldest or most prosperous colonies, which may be another world within their home system — such as Luna or Mars for Humans — or one of the first worlds colonized after the culture achieved interstellar flight. These colonies often develop a fiercely independent outlook, often having developed with little direct aid from their homeworld, and a sense of pride that accompanies being amongst the first of their kind to tame another world.

The character comes from a colony that is isolated from broader galactic society. Worlds like the Vulcan monastery on P’Jem use the vast distances between star systems as an opportunity for contemplative isolation, while others are settled because they present unique research opportunities. The cultures of these colonies tend to focus on learning and introspection.

The character comes from a colony located on the fringes of known space, either on the edge of uncharted space or on the border with another civilization. Frontier colonists tend to be hardy and determined, even stubborn, and well-prepared for the dangers that their home may pose.

The character grew up in space, travelling aboard a starship or living aboard a space station or starbase. While they’re unlikely to have lived aboard a Starfleet vessel — only some of them carry families — many freighters, transports, and other civilian vessels have a tradition of family or generational crews, and many officers with families take postings to starbases rather than ships. Those raised in space learn the ins-and-outs of shipboard life as children, and many are groomed for leadership, or learn to fly a shuttle in their formative years.

The character grew up amongst another species. They might have lived amongst a small enclave of their own kind, or they may have been orphaned by some manner of disaster and raised by aliens. Whatever the situation, the character has unique perspectives on their own species and on those they were raised alongside.

You hail from the Klingon homeworld of Qo’noS, often called Kronos by outsiders, and you’ve been surrounded by the cultural and spiritual legacies of Kahless and the Empire for your entire life. The oldest and most revered of Klingon traditions came from your homeworld, and they are a defining part of your upbringing.

You come from one of the Empire’s oldest or most prosperous colonies. These colonies often have a fiercely independent outlook, having developed with little aid from the Empire in their earliest days, and the pride that accompanies being amongst the first of their kind to tame an alien world still remains in the descendants of those first settlers.

You come from a colony isolated from the rest of the Empire, and from the wider Galaxy. Worlds like Boreth use this isolation as an opportunity for spirituality and contemplation, while others are settled because they present unique opportunities to perform research far from the scrutiny and politicking of the core worlds. Even in the Empire, these worlds emphasize learning and introspection.

You come from a colony located on the fringes of the Empire, either on the edge of explored space or on the border with the Federation or the Romulan Empire. Your world may even have been claimed from one of those rival powers during a conflict in previous generations. Frontier colonies tend to produce determined people, stubborn and well-prepared for the dangers their home may present, and entirely willing to fight to keep what they have settled.

You grew up in space, travelling aboard a starship or living aboard a space station. You won’t have been raised aboard a warship, but many freighters, transports, and other civilian vessels have a tradition of family or generational crews. Those raised in space learn the ways of shipboard life as children, and many take to a spacefaring life easily as a result.

You grew up amongst non-Klingons. Perhaps you were part of a Klingon enclave overseeing a conquered world, or you were raised amongst exiles, or orphaned during a battle or disaster and raised by aliens. You might have been raised in the Empire, or you may be an outsider to it. Whatever the situation, you have chosen to serve the Empire and prove that you are as Klingon as anyone born on Qo’noS, even if you may have different perspectives on Klingon culture and tradition.

You were raised in an environment of peace, prosperity, and abundance. There was no war on your world, nor any poverty, homelessness, hunger, or crime. You knew of those things only from studies of history and you have never really been able to understand how a society could produce such destructive inequality. You have always had access to the resources to not merely survive, but to thrive in whatever endeavors you chose to pursue.

You were raised in environments of trade or diplomacy, and the intermingling of different communities and cultures. The unfamiliar has always been familiar to you, and you had become familiar with dozens of cultures from distant worlds long before you were an adult. The frenetic pace of life and the basic need to revel in differences between groups and individuals have stayed with you as simple facts of existence in this big Galaxy.

You have always been surrounded by notions of duty and purpose, and your childhood was a strict one, aimed at preparing you to take on a specific role or to achieve a specific goal. This meant relatively little personal freedom, but it instilled within you a powerful sense of what you were capable of when pushed to succeed.

Your life was a simple one, lacking in many of the luxuries that prosperous worlds take for granted. This was not because of a lack, but rather a choice – a belief amongst those you grew up with that external and material abundance can distract from self-knowledge and personal growth.

For one reason or another, your world was one with few available resources. Worlds on the frontier, as well as isolated outposts, are often places of hardship where continued survival is difficult, while other worlds struggle in the wake of natural or ecological disasters, the aftermath of war, or societal collapse that leaves basic infrastructure in ruins. Some seek out worlds such as this, where “honest toil” is held as a virtue, while others find themselves in lives of daily struggle through no choice of their own and seek to either better their world or escape it.

Though the Federation’s members no longer war amongst themselves, warfare is still a part of the Galaxy. Local or planetary conflicts afflict many independent worlds, and interstellar conflicts ranging from border skirmishes to sector-spanning wars are something which all civilizations must prepare to face. Worlds ravaged by war, or even occupied by a hostile nation, are difficult places to live, often forcing people to adapt to horrific conditions and life-or-death decisions.

This Value should reflect the environment and culture the character was raised within. This is a good opportunity to consider how the character views their own culture, and how they connect — or possibly, don’t connect — to the philosophies and traditions of their people.
The character gains a single Value, which should reflect some aspect of the character’s beliefs that developed during their time at the Academy.
The character gains a single Value, which should reflect some aspect of the character’s beliefs that developed during their Education.
The character gains a single Value, which should reflect some aspect of the character’s beliefs that developed during their Training.

The character receives one final Value. This might reflect the Career Events rolled in Step Six, or it may represent some other element of the character. This Value might be a relationship, connecting the character to another character in the crew, or to another organization or culture in some way.
